TherapyTypes.title: Solutions Focused Brief Therapy (SFBT)
description: Miracle question useful for goal setting or de-bogging client
Focus on “how” over “why” more effective for anxiety/stress
Particularly effective for limited sessions or unknown number of sessions

TherapyTypes.title: Cognitive Behavioural Therapy (CBT)
description: Suitable in majority situations, such as; Depression, Anxiety (GAD / general stress), PTSD, OCD, Phobias, Marital issues
Requires effective structuring and session planning
points: Play the script until the end

TherapyTypes.title: Narrative Therapy
description: Effective for patients who don’t respond well to structured sessions
More fluid than SFBT/CBT/ACT but more directed than PCT
Use of “chapters” can also be used for coaching purposes
points: Externalise the problem via position mapping
Re-author conversations via including neglected aspects of selves and shifting to a problem centered narrative
Remembering conversations that actively engage the client in finding meaning in their story that is no longer problem saturated vs resilience rich

TherapyTypes.title: Person Centered Therapy (PCT)
description: Effective for patients seeking to gain increased sense of confidence and identity
Often integrated with other research-based therapies
points: Don’t make decisions for your clients
Concentrate on what they are really saying
How you speak can be more important than what you say

TherapyTypes.title: Acceptance Commitment Therapy (ACT)
description: More effective comparatively for chronic pain and things outside of patient’s control
6 cores: Acceptance, Cognitive De-fusion, Being present, Self as context, Values, Committed action
